sections.title: Forest Warden (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Forest Warden class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens are proficient with all simple and martial weapons, light armor, and bucklers.

sections.title: Forest Magic (Sp) (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens gain spell-like abilities from nature-themed spell lists, with usage frequency increasing as they level and new spell options unlocking at specific levels.

sections.title: Unchained Heart (Ex) (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens gain increasing bonuses on Will saves against compulsions and mind-affecting effects, and receive attack bonuses against the source when they succeed.

sections.title: Aligned Class (Ex) (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens choose a previous class as their aligned class and gain additional levels in that class while retaining prestige class progression.

sections.title: Bonus Feats (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens gain bonus feats from a specific list focused on combat tactics, metamagic, and battlefield control at certain levels.

sections.title: Guerrilla Tactics (Ex) (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens can activate different tactical stances as swift actions, each providing unique combat benefits like sneak attack or improved flanking maneuvers.

sections.title: Advanced Tactics (Ex) (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens gain access to additional tactical options including improved surprise round actions and ranged dirty trick attempts.

sections.title: Second Tactic (Ex) (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens can benefit from two guerrilla tactics simultaneously and change one of them as a swift action.

sections.title: Phantom Strike (Ex) (Forest Warden)
sections.description: Forest wardens ignore movement penalties and can deal bonus precision damage or cause cowering against unaware opponents a limited number of times per day.
